channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon receives 50th birthday card branding Boris Johnson a 'first class clown'
item.description: Peter Murrell posted a picture on social media of the range of congratulatory messages received by his wife, the SNP leader, last night as she celebrated her half-century.

item.title: Kanye West's publicist says 'let YE be YE' after abortion claims
item.description: The 43-year-old rapper's rep, Trevian Kutti, tweeted an image on Monday that read: 'Let YE be YE. That's when the gospel comes', adding that 'surely the world does not want to miss this blessing'.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Kim Kardashian needs to stop Kanye West
item.description: Kanye West needs help. The rap star's performance last night at his supposed 'campaign rally' in Charleston was one of the most shocking and disturbing celebrity meltdowns I've witnessed.

item.title: Pharmacist's murder at hands of husband who strangled her 'should be classed as honour killing'
item.description: Mitesh Patel, 37, spent five years planning Jessica's murder so he could use her frozen embryos to have a family with a lover in Australia he met on gay dating app Grindr.

item.title: Music magazine 'Q' will fold after 34 years as editor announces 'the pandemic did for us'Â
item.description: Q Magazine editor Ted Kessler blamed the decision on coronavirus. It's circulation dropped to just 28,359 by the end of 2019, after a high of 200,000 in 2001.

item.title: Grenfell building firm felt refurb 'didn't need fire consultant'
item.description: The main contractor on the refurbishment of Grenfell Tower 'came to the conclusion' that the project 'didn't need a fire consultant', the inquiry into the blaze has heard.

item.title: Sunbathers flee Bournemouth seafront as 'person cooking in a beach hut' sparks massive fire
item.description: The was started by a gas stove being used inside one of the wooden huts along the busy promenade just 400 yards from the four-star Highcliff Marriott Hotel.

item.title: Shirtless Conor McGregor poses with Prince Albert of Monaco and takes on Princess Charlene
item.description: Irish retired UFC fighter Conor McGregor, 32, was cheered on by his girlfriendÂ Dee Devlin, 32, as he raced Princess Charlene of Monaco, 42, in the waters off Monte Carlo.

item.title: Amber Heard and friends 'put heads together' to lie about Depp
item.description: Amber Heard and two of her friends were accused of 'putting their heads together' to lie about claims that Depp attacked her and also smashed up the their Los Angeles penthouse in 2016.

item.title: RSPCA urges careful disposal of face masks after seagull rescue
item.description: A young seagull has been rescued by the RSPCA after its feet got tangled in a coroanvirus face mask. A team discovered the bird in Chelmsford, Essex, on Saturday.

item.title: I'm bringing back my coronavirus briefings Trump boasts because 'record numbers of people watched'
item.description: Donald Trump touted Monday he will resume the 'very successful' briefings on the pandemic starting Tuesday after his frequent appearances at the White House Coronavirus Task Force updates ceased.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Sussex Royal charity reported
item.description: Campaign group Republic claim Â£145,000 was transferred from The Royal Foundation to Sussex Royal. They also allege Â£145,000 was transferred to Travalyst, Harry's eco-tourism scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: Oxford University vaccine provokes immune reaction
item.description: Oxford University's Covid-19 vaccine is safe and provokes an immune reaction, findings of the first phases of the trial show.

item.title: Woman lost baby when tree branch smashed car windscreen
item.description: A council has been handed a Â£150,000 fine after a heavily pregnant woman lost her baby when a tree branch fell and smashed her car's windscreen.

item.title: Kardashians 'shocked' by Kanye West's presidential rally
item.description: Kim Kardashian and her family have been left 'shocked' and 'upset' after Kanye West, 43, revealed during a rally in South Carolina that he and his wife considered aborting their daughter North.

item.title: Johnny Depp's US lawyer is slammed for 'macabre, threatening, sinister' tweet
item.description: Adam Waldman's tweet read: 'In memoriam, Elon Musk's decorator Laura Divenere' after she had given evidence on Friday and called him the 'biggest a**hole under the sun'.

item.title: Dominic Raab announces extradition treaty with Hong Kong is being suspended
item.description: Dominic Raab today announced the UK's extradition treaty with Hong Kong is being 'immediately and indefinitely' suspended.

item.title: Delivery giant Hermes will create over 10,000 new UK jobs
item.description: Delivery giant Hermes will create more than 10,000 new jobs in the UK as it invests Â£100 million to meet the demand from stay-at-home shoppers.

item.title: Prince Charles and Camilla appear in high spirits as they kickstart three day visit to Cornwall
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall, 73, kept a cool head on the first day of her annual trip as paramedics at the Cornwall Air Ambulance Trust were forced to leave the engagement early to attend an emergency.

item.title: Disney World bans eating and drinking while walking around the theme park
item.description: Officials with Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida, on Monday updated its face mask policies to now prohibit guests from eating and drinking while walking through parks to enforce to promote social distancing

item.title: Blackburn overtakes Leicester as UK's coronavirus hotspot
item.description: The borough of Blackburn with Darwen in Lancashire has a rate of 79.2 Covid-19 cases per 100,000 in the seven days to July 17, according to the latest data from Public Health England.

item.title: Nurseries can no longer afford to offer 30 hours' free childcare for working parents
item.description: Nurseries may opt out of a scheme which offers parents in England up to 30 hours of free childcare for children aged three or four. It comes as capacity drops due to social distancing.

item.title: Chief nurse Ruth May WAS axed from TV after failing to back Dominic Cummings' Durham lockdown trip
item.description: Chief Nursing Officer Ruth May confirmed she was 'stood down' from a Downing Street press briefing in May after a meeting in which adherence to the lockdown measures was raised.

item.title: Charlie Elphicke weeps as he tells court how he LIED to police
item.description: Charlie Elphicke, Conservative MP for Dover between 2010 and 2019, said he tried to keep his affair secret while insisting he did not sexually assault two women.

item.title: Meghan Markle's mother Doria Ragland has reportedly moved in with her and Prince Harry
item.description: Meghan Markle's mother Doria Ragland, 63, is continuing to live with her and Prince Harry, a source told UsWeekly - making it the most time she has spent with her grandson since he was born.'

item.title: Bar Refaeli appears in court as she and her mother are convicted for tax evasion in IsraelÂ
item.description: The model, 35, who entered the Tel Aviv courthouse in a white face mask, was convicted ofÂ four counts of tax offences earlier today, alongside her mother, Tzipi.

item.title: 'Sex cult' led by man, 77, for 30 years uncovered in Italy
item.description: Police in northern Italy have carried out raids against an alleged cult and its leader - a 77-year-old man known only as the doctor - who is accused of torturing and sexually abusing his followers.

item.title: Antibody tests are back on the market in Superdrug
item.description: Superdrug had to shut down its antibody testing service in May when officials said companies weren't allowed to use finger-prick blood for the kits, but it is now back up and running for Â£20 more.

item.title: Seniors who identify smells 'half as likely to develop dementia'
item.description: In a study of nearly 1,800 participants tracked for a decade,Â US scientists found that a decline in the ability to smell was an early indicator of the syndrome.

item.title: Global warming could see most polar bears disappear by 2100
item.description: Researchers from the University of Toronto in Canada said 'aggressive' cuts to greenhouse gas emissions are now needed to save the animals.

item.title: Boy racers ignore social distancing and cause huge traffic jams as they attend massive car meet
item.description: Footage showed hundreds of people ignoring social distancing rules as they watched the meet outside the Showcase cinema, near the A13 in Barking, east London.

item.title: Micro studio flat that has shower and sink next to the bed goes on sale in Notting Hill for Â£200,000
item.description: A micro studio flat with a shower and sink right next to the bed has gone on sale in Notting Hill for Â£200,000. The 79-square foot flat is up for sale in Notting Hill, and is also fitted with a toilet cubicle.

item.title: Multi-millionaire, 50, tries to get his mother, 75, sent to jail in row over Â£10m caravan empireÂ
item.description: Michael Loveridge, 50, is battling his parents Ivy, 75, and Alldey, 78, for control of their 'solvent, highly profitable and cash-rich' chain of caravan parks and caravan sales business in Worcs.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 11 new fatalities in daily death toll
item.description: Department of Health bosses posted 580 more Covid-19 cases - taking the rolling seven-day mean of infections to 628 after the rate dropped to a four-month low of 546 on July 8.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'had list of insults for Amber Heard's co-stars
item.description: Mr Depp nicknamed Mr DiCaprio 'pumpkin-head' during fits of rage sparked because her 'very jealous' husband took against any 'male co-stars he considered a sexual threat' in 'movie after movie'.

item.title: KFC tests 3D-printed CHICKEN NUGGETS and could even produce drumsticks with bones if tech improves
item.description: The fast-food chain announced its partnership with a biotech research firm in Russia on Thursday in the hope of creating authentic-tasting meat alternatives.

item.title: 'Jealous' Johnny Depp hated Amber Heard shooting sex scenes
item.description: Ms Heard claimed she found herself turning down work and said her salary fell every year she was with him because Mr Depp was so jealous of other men during their marriage.

item.title: Actor Johnny Ortiz arrested over charges of attempted murder
item.description: Actor Johnny Ortiz has been arrested and charged with premeditated attempted murder charges, after being taken into custody back in May, and is currently behind bars.

item.title: Amber Heard admits taking MDMA and magic mushrooms at Coachella music festival
item.description: The American actress (pictured leaving court in London today) said she is not a 'habitual drug user' and while she does drink wine, she does not like to get drunk.

item.title: Government urged to review pension tax relief
item.description: The Public Accounts Committee said the Government did not understand the impact of pension tax breaks, including the differing rates of relief on contributions.

item.title: Mother, 82, and her daughter, 64, survive being trapped in a lift by drinking each other's urineÂ
item.description: The pair were using the elevator built inside their four-storey house to go upstairs when the machine suddenly broke down. They drank each other's body fluids to remain alive for 96 hours.

item.title: Woman, 30, hospitalised with coronavirus left partially BALD
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Grace Dudley, 30, of Romford, Essex, spent almost a fortnight in hospital after contracting Covid-19 from her father. She is now experiencing severe hair loss caused by her illness.

item.title: Hundreds of migrant boats intercepted in the English Channel are being stored at warehouse complex
item.description: The boats at the storage facility in Dover, Kent, are stacked three high and vary from fibreglass rowing boats to high tech large ribs.

item.title: Three cartels ambush Mexican military who fight back in a hail of gunfire
item.description: At least five members of different cartels were arrested after a failed ambush attempt against the military in MichoacÃ¡n, Mexico, Friday. The war-like battle left one soldier wounded.

item.title: UK's oldest and youngest locations
item.description: The study found older people typically live near the coast and Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty - with areas such as Dorset topping the list as most ageing.

item.title: Princess Eugenie shares touching tribute to Princess Beatrice after wedding
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 31, shared a gushing tribute on Instagram to 'beautiful big sister' Princess Beatrice, 30, after the royal married Edo Mapelli Mozzi, 36, in a secret ceremony on Friday.

item.title: Clare's Law campaigner Michael Brown dies aged 76 after winning battle for a woman's 'right to know'
item.description: Campaigner Michael Brown died at the Royal Hallamshire Hospital in Sheffield on Saturday following a short and sudden illness.

item.title: Anti-chafe SIHOHAN Women's Slip Shorts review Amazon
item.description: Amazon shoppers are recommending the SIHOHAN Women's Slip Shorts to help say goodbye to thigh chafing this summer, AND they are now in the sale for only Â£9.99 on Amazon.

item.title: Loose Women: Denise Welch urges Coleen Nolan to stop smoking
item.description: Loose Women's Denise Welch, 62, clashed with Coleen Nolan, 55, on today's show over smoking, admitting that she can't stand the habit since giving up seven years ago.

item.title: Russia's political elite 'have been given experimental Covid-19 vaccine since April'Â
item.description: It is thought thatÂ billionaire tycoons and government officials began getting shots developed by the state-run Gamaleya Institute in Moscow as early as April.

item.title: Viewers brand Netflix's Indian Matchmaking a 'cesspool of casteism, colourism, sexism and classism'
item.description: 'Mortified' Netflix viewers have taken to Twitter to criticise new dating show Indian Matchmaking for glorifying archaic ideas and reinforcing stereotypes when it comes to arranged marriages.

item.title: Pubs and restaurants must offer non-smoking areas outdoors
item.description: Ministers last night tabled an amendment to the Business and Planning Bill requiring businesses to make 'reasonable provision' for non-smoking seating.

item.title: Princes William and Harry 'need to be in same country to fix rift'
item.description: Prince William and Prince Harry will not be able to broach the topic of their 'rift' until they are in the same country,Â former royal press secretary Dickie Arbiter has said.

item.title: Johnny Depp secretly records Amber Heard admitting she hit him
item.description: The audio was released by Mr Depp's legal team as Ms Heard started her first day giving evidence in her ex-husband's London libel trial with The Sun after being branded a 'wife-beater'.

item.title: Coronavirus India: Cases hit 1.1m with 40,425 in one day
item.description: The 40,425 new cases announced today bring the total from 1,077,618 to 1,118,043, three days after India became the third country in the world to pass a million cases.

item.title: London stab victim was sister of girl, 14, murdered 28 years ago
item.description: Peter Petrou, 37, was today named by Scotland Yard as the victim killed outside McDonald's on Kilburn High Road on Thursday.

item.title: Police issue new pictures of eight Colston statute protestors
item.description: The slave trader's statue was pulled down on June 7 before being dumped in Bristol Harbour in the most dramatic of the UK Black Lives Matter protests that sprung up after the killing of George Floyd.

item.title: Russian businessman tells High Court that ex-MI6 spy Christopher Steele harmed his reputation
item.description: Aleksej Gubarev is suing the former MI6 operative (pictured) whose 2016 private intelligence report alleged ties between Donald Trump's election campaign and the Kremlin.

item.title: Man, 39, 'who stabbed 23-year-old woman to death at Holiday Inn hotel'
item.description: Taye Francis, 39, is accused of murderingÂ Khloemae Loy, 23, at the hotel in Greenwich, south-east London on July 5.

item.title: Taking cholesterol-lowering drug could reduce severity of coronavirus to the level of common cold
item.description: Scientists working in Jerusalem and New York believe that may have found a surprising treatment for COVID-19 - a cholesterol-lowering drug which makes the virus weaker.

item.title: UK mother loses custody of daughter after failing to leave cult
item.description: In a High Court judgment in July, a judge found the woman had made a 'very limited disassociation' from Universal Medicine (pictured, its UK HQ) and ruled the girl should live with her father.

item.title: Prince Philip, 99, to take part in rare public engagement
item.description: Prince Philip, who retired in 2017, will transfer his role as Colonel-in-Chief of The Rifles to the Duchess of Cornwall on Wednesday. They will take part in simultaneous events 100 miles apart.

item.title: Tycoon loses 9-year battle to turn pub into holiday flats
item.description: Peter Wilkinson (pictured) had the 300-year-old Plough Inn boarded up after being refused permission to turn it into offices for his 19,000-acre estate on the North York Moors.

item.title: UK company makes 'largest commercial hybrid electric plane'
item.description: The 70-person seater 'hybrid electric regional aircraft' (HERA) has a 'whisper-quiet' operation to reduce noise pollution andÂ airborne battery regeneration.

item.title: Prince Andrew seen after Princess Beatrice wedding photos snub
item.description: Princess Beatrice marriedÂ Italian property developer Edo Mapelli Mozzi in a surprise ceremony in Windsor - though Prince Andrew was notably absent in photos.

item.title: Concentration camp guard apologises to Holocaust victims
item.description: Bruno Dey, 93, spokeÂ at a court in Hamburg, Germany, earlier today during the high-profile trial over his complicity in the atrocities of the Second World War.

item.title: Are celebrity diets REALLY good for you? A nutritionist decides
item.description: British-born Mia Challiner, went viral after eating food inspired by her favourite celebrities for 24 hours and now nutritionist Mays Al-Ali, from London has told FEMAIL how healthy these meals actually are.

item.title: Kindergarten pupils are savagely beaten by their teachers for 'failing to nap' in ChinaÂ
item.description: Shocking videos reportedly show the two nursery staff members violently pushing the children around or slapping them on multiple occasions in eastern Chinese province Zhejiang.

item.title: Parents sue 'negligent' Bristol University after daughter's suicide
item.description: Robert and Margaret Abrahart (pictured) from Nottingham, whose child Natasha took her own life in April 2018, claim she was a victim of disability discrimination.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson's Cabinet to meet WITHOUT masksÂ
item.description: The regular weekly meeting chaired by the Prime Minister will take place in a large room at the Foreign Office in the morning to allow ministers to sit at least one metre apart.

item.title: Youthful Hong Kong actress Carman Lee has barely aged in 30 years
item.description: Carman Lee Yeuk-tung sent the internet into a frenzy recently after sharing a picture of her firm six-pack abs. Fans were further stunned last week by photos of her from three decades ago.

item.title: Learners can take driving tests again from 22 July
item.description: Practical tests will restart in England from Wednesday (22 July), though only candidates who have had their already-booked exams put on hold will get the chance to sit their exam this week.

item.title: German woman raped in Spanish dive instructor's boat in Majorca
item.description: The attack allegedly happened on Friday during a dive trip off Cabrera (file photo), a national park which is 11 miles off the southern coast of Majorca.

item.title: Ken Clarke on Boris Johnson's first anniversary honours list
item.description: A list of approximately 30 new peers is expected to be published in the coming weeks to mark Mr Johnson's first completed year in Downing Street.

item.title: Senior Wirecard exec 'hiding in Russia under GRU protection'
item.description: Jan Marsalek, COO of Wirecard and prime suspect in an alleged Â£1.7billion fraud at the firm, is now thought to be hiding in an apartment west of Moscow under the protection of the GRU.

item.title: Scientists create new species of fish called a sturddlefish
item.description: A team from theÂ Research Institute for Fisheries and Aquaculture, Hungary, were trying to coax eggs from the endangered sturgeon into reproducing asexually.

item.title: How losing weight can stop your snoring
item.description: Dr Michael Mosley, the British creator of the 5:2 diet, explained unhealthy lifestyle factors like being overweight are behind snoring for many people.

item.title: 'Naked Athena' protester confronts Portland police
item.description: The unidentified woman struck a series of ballet and yoga poses in front of anti-riot officers at around 1.45 am on Saturday morning.

item.title: Lady Amelia Windsor wears a mask on London UndergroundÂ
item.description: Amelia Windsor has embraced post-lockdown rules in London, wearing a mask as she joined commuters on the underground this weekend.

item.title: Iran executes second man accused of spying for CIA
item.description: Mahmoud Mousavi Majd, a translator who worked with Iran's Revolutionary Guard, was executed on Monday after being accused of selling information to the US and Israel.

item.title: Alice Munro wows thousands after creating an incredibly realistic cake looks like raw chicken breast
item.description: Grandmother-of-10 Alice Munro, from Tasmania, has wowed the internet after sharing a simple picture of raw chicken breasts on social media - but not everything is as it seems.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK 'can't count on' vaccine this year or next
item.description: Agreement has been reached for 30million doses from BioNTech and German firm Pfizer and 60million doses fromÂ France's Valneva.

item.title: Bristol's black mayor abused by BOTH BLM and Britain First
item.description: Bristol mayor Marvin Rees, 48, ordered the removal of a statue of Jen Reid, a Black Lives Matter protester, just 24 hours after it was erected.

item.title: Hospitals in Derby and Burton start using UV disinfection ROBOTS
item.description: Staff in the Infection Prevention and Control team atÂ Derby and Burton hospitals are now being trained to properly use the new equipment.
item.media:credit: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS

item.title: Marks & Spencer to cut 950 job cuts in 'first wave' of cull
item.description: The announcement comes after fellow British chains John Lewis and Boots have already shed thousands of staff in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: 15,000 apply for just TEN vacancies in Birmingham factory
item.description: Lontra is opening the new line in Tyseley, Birmingham, later this year, assembling industrial machines from components manufactured across the UK.

item.title: 'Mini boom' pushes house prices to record high, says Rightmove
item.description: The property portal said the average asking price of homes coming to the market in Britain is 2.4 per cent, or Â£7,640 higher, than before the lockdown at a record Â£320,265.

item.title: Mystery as lake from iconic Dirty Dancing lift scene fills with water
item.description: Mountain Lake Lodge inÂ Southwest Virginia was the location for the famousÂ 'Dirty Dancing' scene whereÂ Baby practices a lift for her dance withÂ Johnny Castle.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain hit by 200 outbreaks since easing lockdown
item.description: A beach in Barcelona, a wedding inÂ Tudela and a Red Cross centre in Malaga are among the places where new clusters of cases have been found in recent weeks.

item.title: London home of Bank of England Governor Mark Carney goes up for sale for Â£5.5million
item.description: The semi-detached Victorian property, which boasts eight bedrooms and a separate staff studio, was home to Canadian-born Mr Carney, 55, his wife Diana, and their four daughters.

item.title: Fresh outbreak in Xinjiang spreads to a second city as Hong Kong faces 'out of control' surge
item.description: Xinjiang reported a confirmed infection in China's westernmost city of Kashgar after detecting a fresh outbreak in Urumqi. Hong Kong recorded the highest one-day rise in COVID-19 cases.

item.title: British engineers create the world's first 'uncuttable' material
item.description: It has been named Proteus after the shape-changing Greek god of the sea and is both lightweight, strong and also capable of dispersing any waterjet.

item.title: Coronavirus 'breakthrough' as inhaled drug treatment slashes ICU admissions by 79%
item.description: Results from the trial- led by Southampton University - have been described as the 'biggest breakthrough in Covid-19 treatment to date'. The protein interferon beta is inhaled using a nebuliser.

item.title: Zoo Pairi Daiza Resort in Belgium opens suite with views into a walrus tank
item.description: The incredible suite, called the Walrus House, can be found at the award-winning Pairi Daiza Resort in Belgium. It has opulent lodges, suites and rooms that overlook the territories of a number of animals.

item.title: Hero policeman jumped out of 13th FLOOR window to catch 'paedophile'
item.description: Bakytzhan Bakirov, 36, was called to a 13th floor apartment in Almaty, Kazakhstan, to reports that a girl had been attacked. When the suspect fled and jumped out a window, he followed.

item.title: Are YOUR home renovations reducing the price of your property?
item.description: Paul Keighley who is Director at Bramleys in Huddersfield, revealed the interior design choices that can reduce the price of your property after many people spent lockdown working on DIY projects.

item.title: TikTok is 'as much a threat to Britain' as Huawei warn senior Tory MPs
item.description: The party's former leader Sir Iain Duncan Smith called for the app to be banned because of its links with the 'Chinese intelligence services'.

item.title: Jair Bolsonaro holds up hydroxychloroquine drug in Brazil
item.description: Bolsonaro greeted his fans outside the presidential palace in Brasilia where he has been in quarantine since announcing his positive test result on July 7.

item.title: Zayn Malik fans demand Spotify remove shocking 'Islamophobic' song titled Zayn Did 9/11
item.description: Zayn Malik fans have flocked to social media to demand Spotify remove a song that brands the singer 'a terrorist'.

item.title: US coronavirus deaths surpass 140,000 as outbreak worsens in Florida
item.description: US deaths from the novel coronavirus topped 140,000 on Saturday as cases continued to rise in 42 out of 50 states over the past two weeks, according to a Reuters tally.

item.title: Beatrice and Edo's 'pure and straightforward' romance
item.description: Princess Beatrice and Edo Mapelli Mozzi's 'open and natural smiles' showed they were 'lost in their own bubble of love', body language expert Judi James told FEMAIL.

item.title: Grade I-listed Georgian mansion goes up for sale for Â£8m
item.description: Mamhead House, which sprawls over 164 acres of Exmouth countryside, is poised to become the most expensive home ever sold in Devon if it fetches the cool Â£7.95million asking price.

item.title: Britain 'will suspend its extradition treaty with Hong Kong'
item.description: Dominic Raab will today announce the UK is suspending its extradition treaty with Hong Kong as Britain's row with China continues to escalate.

item.title: Father discovers set of Pokemon cards he was given 20 years ago are worth Â£35,000Â
item.description: Nigel Brookes, 34, from Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, was gifted the complete set for his 13th birthday in 1999 after he stood up for his seven-year-old brother Jeremy.

item.title: Astrophysicists unveil biggest-ever 3D map of the universe
item.description: The map from a collaboration of international researchers provides an accurate look at the scale and expansion of the universe from shortly after the Big Bang through to the modern era.

item.title: Man on a lockdown litter pick finds 1,800-year-old Roman coin that he initially thought was a euroÂ
item.description: Chris Lyon, 27, discovered the ancient artefact at Carr Mill Dam in St Helens, while out litter-picking with his girlfriend. He took to Facebook to see if anyone knew its origin and was shocked at the answer

item.title: Blackburn woman is forced to go to a relative's house after being followed by a suspicious man
item.description: CCTV footage shows the victim dart into the front garden and knock on the door as the stalker lurks across the road in Great Harwood, Blackburn, Lancashire.

item.title: Woman in her 50s tried to abduct two-year-old boy in park
item.description: The attempted child-snatcher grabbed the toddler by the wrist and tried to drag him away from the bandstand at Sefton Park (pictured), Liverpool, at 2.50pm.

item.title: Benidorm policeman 'kneels on sunbather's neck' as he arrested
item.description: Police in Benidorm were filmed arresting a man after he stripped off in order to go swimming at a public beach, causing an outcry online after one of them placed his knee on the man's neck.

item.title: Daredevil climbs a lamppost and finds a trove of lost footballs on a roof
item.description: The man discovered more than a dozen footballs on a roof in Stirling, Scotland, after climbing a lamppost near the building.

item.title: Cerys Matthews admits mistake after playing song containing racist slur on BBC
item.description: The presenter, 51, featured Scottish country music singer Thomas Fraser's cover of the 1940 song TheÂ Mississippi Shore, which contains the word 'darkies'.

item.title: Staffordshire bull terrier cross is shot dead by armed police after attacking owner
item.description: Officers were scrambled to an address in Sandown on the Isle of Wight after being alerted to a woman being attacked by the Staffordshire bull terrier-mastiff cross at 10pm on Sunday.

item.title: Leeds clean-up is underway after huge fan party left litter in Millennium Square
item.description: Council workers were out in force as they used shovels to sift through piles of empty cans and bottles which left bins overflowing in Leeds city centre this morning.

item.title: Jazmin Grimaldi, the daughter of Prince Albert II of Monaco, has tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: Jazmin Grimaldi, 28, has penned an emotional Instagram post revealing she has tested positive for Covid-19 - four months after her father, Prince Albert II of Monaco, was diagnosed with the virus.

item.title: Woman who gave up son in 1957 urged people not to pre-judge her
item.description: Pat Walker, from West Sussex, asked on Lorraine not to be 'pre-judged' on her actions as a 17-year-old as she appeared to talk about reuniting with her son Richard Cue on Long Lost Family.

item.title: Mother and daughter with alopecia share bare-headed selfies
item.description: Kiri Atkinson from Worcestershire spent seven years wearing wigs, but decided to share bare-headed selfies with her daughter Paiva, two, to educate and empower her ahead of starting nursery.

item.title: Cambridgeshire Police find body in search for 'stressed and anxious' father-of-two
item.description: Cambridgeshire Police found Stephen Ridley's body in water at Roswell Pits Nature Reserve, near Ely, on Saturday after he went missing last Monday. He is pictured with his wife Denise.

item.title: Grandmother,51, dating man 16 years her junior insists she's happier than ever
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Joanna Turner, 51, from Surrey, told Femail how she ended her ten-year relationship after falling for Christopher D'Rozario, 35, when he liked her weight-loss images on Facebook.

item.title: Russian TV psychologist and sexologist found dead at Moscow hotel
item.description: Anna Ambartsumyan (pictured), 26, was found dead at the five-star Peter 1 hotel in Moscow with a Prada handbag and a black dress on the bed.

item.title: Queen Letizia and King Felipe VI of Spain look relaxed in casual outfits as they head to the cinema
item.description: Queen Letizia, 47, and King Felipe of Spain, 52, headed to the cinema in Madrid on Saturday for a casual date night. The royals left their two daughters, Leonor, 14 and Sofia, 13, at home.

item.title: Charming home on Love Actually mews in Notting Hill goes on sale for Â£2.75million
item.description: A charming two-bedroom house on theÂ cobbled St Luke's Mews in west London's Notting Hill, where the romantic Love Actually scene was filmed, is on the market with Knight Frank.

item.title: Onlookers battle in vain to rescue van being swamped by rising tide after driver parked it on beach
item.description: A white van became stuck in the ocean on Redcar beach in Teesside on Sunday afternoon. The coastguard spent hours trying to free the vehicle as the tide came in and surrounded the car.

item.title: Off-duty officer saves a young boy from a shark swimming 'dangerously close' in FloridaÂ
item.description: Officer AdrianÂ Kosicki was off-duty and spending time with his family when he jumped into the Atlantic Ocean to save a young boogie-boarding boy from a shark in Cocoa Beach, Florida

item.title: Animal lovers share hilarious photos of their beloved pets looking very ugly
item.description: Twitter users from all over the world have shared very ugly pictures of their beloved pets in a hilarious Twitter thread. From unfortunately angles to bad timing, these definitely won't make it to Instagram.
